get.summary: getTestResources() - Get resources for this service.
get.description: Return an array of the resources available.
Return a list of the resource identifiers.

parameters.name: as_list
parameters.description: Return only a list of the resource identifiers.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of properties to be returned for each resource, "*" returns all properties. If as_list, use this to override the default identifier.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the identifiers of the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: Refresh any cached resource list on the server.

get.summary: getTestRecords() - Retrieve one or more records.
get.description:
Set the filter parameter to a SQL WHERE clause (optional native filter accepted in some scenarios) to limit records returned or leave it blank to return all records up to the maximum limit.
Set the limit parameter with or without a filter to return a specific amount of records.
Use the offset parameter along with the limit parameter to page through sets of records.
Set the order parameter to SQL ORDER_BY clause containing field and optional direction ( [ASC|DESC]) to order the returned records.
Alternatively, to send the filter with or without params as posted data, use the getRecordsByPost() POST request and post a filter with or without params.
Pass the identifying field values as a comma-separated list in the ids parameter.
Use the id_field and id_type parameters to override or specify detail for identifying fields where applicable.
Alternatively, to send the ids as posted data, use the getRecordsByPost() POST request.
Use the fields parameter to limit properties returned for each record. By default, all fields are returned for all records.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of properties to be returned for each resource, "*" returns all properties. If as_list, use this to override the default identifier.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SQL-like filter to limit the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Set to limit the filter results.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Set to offset the filter results to a particular record count.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: SQL-like order containing field and direction for filter results.

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: Return only the total number of filter results.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Include the total number of filter results in returned metadata.

parameters.name: include_schema
parameters.description: Include the schema of the table queried in returned metadata.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the identifiers of the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, continue processing even after one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: rollback
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, rollback all actions if one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Download the results of the request as a file. This is here for documentation purpose only. File will not download using API Docs.

post.summary: createTestRecords() - Create one or more records.
post.description:
Posted data should be an array of records wrapped in a record element.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success. Use fields parameter to return more info.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing name-value pairs of records to create.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of properties to be returned for each resource, "*" returns all properties. If as_list, use this to override the default identifier.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, continue processing even after one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: rollback
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, rollback all actions if one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: X-HTTP-METHOD
parameters.description: Override request using POST to tunnel other http request, such as DELETE or GET passing a payload.

put.summary: replaceTestRecords() - Update (replace) one or more records.
put.description:
Post data should be an array of records wrapped in a resource tag.
If ids or filter is used, posted body should be a single record with name-value pairs to update, wrapped in a resource tag.
Ids can be included via URL parameter or included in the posted body.
Filter can be included via URL parameter or included in the posted body.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success. Use fields parameter to return more info.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing name-value pairs of records to update.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of properties to be returned for each resource, "*" returns all properties. If as_list, use this to override the default identifier.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the identifiers of the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, continue processing even after one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: rollback
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, rollback all actions if one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SQL-like filter to limit the records to retrieve.

patch.summary: updateTestRecords() - Update (patch) one or more records.
patch.description:
Post data should be an array of records containing at least the identifying fields for each record.
Posted body should be a single record with name-value pairs to update wrapped in a record tag.
Ids can be included via URL parameter or included in the posted body.
Filter can be included via URL parameter or included in the posted body.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success. Use fields parameter to return more info.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A single record containing name-value pairs of fields to update.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of properties to be returned for each resource, "*" returns all properties. If as_list, use this to override the default identifier.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the identifiers of the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, continue processing even after one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: rollback
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, rollback all actions if one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SQL-like filter to limit the records to retrieve.

delete.summary: deleteTestRecords() - Delete one or more records.
delete.description:
Set the ids parameter to a list of record identifying (primary key) values to delete specific records.
Alternatively, to delete records by a large list of ids, pass the ids in the body.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success, use fields to return more info. Set the filter parameter to a SQL WHERE clause to delete specific records, otherwise set force to true to clear the table.
Alternatively, to delete by a complicated filter or to use parameter replacement, pass the filter with or without params as the body.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success, use fields to return more info. Set the body to an array of records, minimally including the identifying fields, to delete specific records.
By default, only the id property of the record is returned on success, use fields to return more info.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data containing ids of records to delete.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of properties to be returned for each resource, "*" returns all properties. If as_list, use this to override the default identifier.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the identifiers of the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: id_field
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: id_type
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

parameters.name: continue
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, continue processing even after one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: rollback
parameters.description: In batch scenarios where supported, rollback all actions if one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: SQL-like filter to limit the records to retrieve.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Set to true to delete all resources in the given table, folder, etc.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the record to retrieve.

parameters.name: table_name
parameters.description: Name of the table to perform operations on.

Use the fields parameter to return more properties. By default, the id is returned.

delete.description: Use the fields parameter to return more deleted properties. By default, the id is returned.

resource.description: Array of resources available to this service.
Array of accessible resources available to this service.

success.description: True when API call was successful, false or error otherwise.

resource.description: Array of accessible resources available to this path.
Array of resources available to this path.
Array of tables and their properties.

label.description: Displayable singular name for the table.

plural.description: Displayable plural name for the table.

primary_key.description: Field(s), if any, that represent the primary key of each record.

name_field.description: Field(s), if any, that represent the name of each record.

field.description: An array of available fields in each record.

related.description: An array of available relationships to other tables.

name.description: The API name of the field.

label.description: The displayable label for the field.

type.description: The DreamFactory abstract data type for this field.

db_type.description: The native database type used for this field.

length.description: The maximum length allowed (in characters for string, displayed for numbers).

precision.description: Total number of places for numbers.

scale.description: Number of decimal places allowed for numbers.

required.description: Is a value required for record creation.

allow_null.description: Is null allowed as a value.

supports_multibyte.description: Does the data type support multibyte characters.

auto_increment.description: Does the integer field value increment upon new record creation.

is_primary_key.description: Is this field used as/part of the primary key.

is_foreign_key.description: Is this field used as a foreign key.

ref_table.description: For foreign keys, the referenced table name.

ref_field.description: For foreign keys, the referenced table field name.

validation.description: validations to be performed on this field.

value.description: Selectable string values for client menus and picklist validation.

alias.description: Alias to use in the API to override the name the relationship.

field.description: The current table field that is used in the relationship.

ref_table.description: The table name that is referenced by the relationship.

ref_field.description: The field name that is referenced by the relationship.

junction_table.description: The intermediate junction table used for many_many relationships.

junction_field.description: The intermediate junction table field used for many_many relationships.

junction_ref_field.description: The intermediate joining table referencing field used for many_many relationships.

always_fetch.description: Always fetch this relationship when querying the parent table.

resource.description: Array of accessible resources available to this path.
Array of resources available to this path.

filter.description: SQL or native filter to determine records where modifications will be applied.

params.description: Array of name-value pairs, used for parameter replacement on filters.

count.description: Record count returned for GET requests.

ids.name: ids
ids.description: Comma-delimited list of the identifiers of the records to retrieve.

id_field.name: id_field
id_field.description: Comma-delimited list of the fields used as identifiers, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

id_type.name: id_type
id_type.description: Comma-delimited list of the field types used as identifiers for the table, used to override defaults or provide identifiers when none are provisioned.

filter.name: filter
filter.description: SQL-like filter to limit the records to retrieve.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Set to limit the filter results.

order.name: order
order.description: SQL-like order containing field and direction for filter results.

group.name: group
group.description: Comma-delimited list of the fields used for grouping of filter results.

having.name: having
having.description: SQL-like filter to limit the results after the grouping of filter results.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Set to offset the filter results to a particular record count.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Comma-delimited list of properties to be returned for each resource, "*" returns all properties. If as_list, use this to override the default identifier.

continue.name: continue
continue.description: In batch scenarios where supported, continue processing even after one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

rollback.name: rollback
rollback.description: In batch scenarios where supported, rollback all actions if one action fails. Default behavior is to halt and return results up to the first point of failure.

related.name: related
related.description: Comma-delimited list of related names to retrieve for each resource.

allow_related_delete.name: allow_related_delete
allow_related_delete.description: Set to true to allow related records to be deleted on parent update.

include_access.name: include_access
include_access.description: Include the access permissions for the returned resource.

count_only.name: count_only
count_only.description: Return only the total number of filter results.

include_count.name: include_count
include_count.description: Include the total number of filter results in returned metadata.

include_schema.name: include_schema
include_schema.description: Include the schema of the table queried in returned metadata.

as_list.name: as_list
as_list.description: Return only a list of the resource identifiers.

as_access_list.name: as_access_list
as_access_list.description: Returns a list of the resources for role access designation.

refresh.name: refresh
refresh.description: Refresh any cached resource list on the server.

regenerate.name: schema
regenerate.description: Generate a new API key for this application.

force.name: force
force.description: Set to true to delete all resources in the given table, folder, etc.

file.name: file
file.description: Download the results of the request as a file. This is here for documentation purpose only. File will not download using API Docs.

schema.name: schema
schema.description: Select only a single schema of a database. Not applicable on all database services.
